text: Psalm 141
Prayer for God’s Help in Maintaining Integrity
A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 141 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
I call on you, O Yahweh; hasten to me.
Listen to my voice when I call to you.
Let my prayer be set before you \add as\add* incense,
the lifting up of my palms \add as the\add* evening offering.
Set a guard, O Yahweh, over my mouth;
keep watch over the door of my lips.
Do not incline my heart to any evil thing,
to practice wicked deeds
with men \add who\add* do iniquity;
and do not let me eat of their delicacies.
Let a righteous one strike me in kindness,
and let him chasten me.
\add It is\add* oil for \add my\add* head;\f + \fr 141:5 \ft Or “It is choice oil” \f* let not my head refuse.
For still my prayer \add is\add* against their evil deeds.

\add When\add* their judges are thrown down \add the\add* sides of a cliff,\f + \fr 141:6 \ft Or “are dropped into the hands of \fq the \ft Rock,” that is, Yahweh. The interpretation of vv. \xt 6–7 \ft is uncertain. \f*
then they will understand that my words were pleasant.
As \add when one\add* plows and breaks up the earth,
\add so\add* our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
But\f + \fr 141:8 \ft Or “Because” \f* my eyes \add are\add* toward you, O Yahweh, my Lord;
I have taken refuge in you. Do not lay bare my soul.\f + \fr 141:8 \ft Or “Do not raze my life” \f*
Protect me from \add the\add* ⸤grasp⸥\f + \fr 141:9 \ft Literally “hand” \f* of \add the\add* trap they have laid for me,
and \add from the\add* snares of evildoers.
Let \add the\add* wicked fall into their\f + \fr 141:10 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* nets,
while I escape altogether.
